The report from the Statewide Task Force: Newborns 2014 Progress Report, which specifically dealt with the effects of opiate abuse by pregnant women on their children, was cited as the source of the claim.
The report stated that in 2010: 98 of the top 100 oxycodone pill dispensing physicians nationally resided in Florida, and by the end of 2012, not one Florida doctor appeared on the top 100 list.
The report used figures that were widely: S. Drug Enforcement Administration data accessed in January 2013.
The claim was also backed up by a DEA pr: 2013, which stated that 90 of the top 100 oxycodone purchasing physicians in the nation were located in Florida.
